intro: Sisymbrium tenuissimum, commonly known as slender broomrape, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a rootless plant that relies on parasitic relationships with host plants for nutrients, primarily growing on the roots of grasses and other herbaceous species. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often appearing in a basal rosette, and it is commonly found in disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. Due to its parasitic nature and limited growth form, it plays a unique ecological role in its habitat.
